Detailed Description

Custom versions of some of the C-style string functions.

Author:
Mike Ciaraldi - for mystrdup

Christopher Bove (cpbove) for other functions

Date:
4-13-15

Function Documentation

char* mystrcat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Duplicates the strcat function of C: appends the src string to the dest string, the terminator is overwritten on dest and terminator is then added. Strings cannot overlap. dest must be large enough for the operation.

Parameters:
dest pointer to string to have contents of src appended onto
src Pointer to string to be appended
Returns:
Pointer to the destination string dest

char* mystrcpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Duplicates the strcpy function of C: string pointed to by src is copied into array pointed to by dest. dest must be large enough to receive the copy.

Parameters:
dest pointer to string to have contents of src copied into
src Pointer to string to be copied
Returns:
Pointer to the destination string dest
Note:
copies src including null terminator character

char* mystrdup ( const char *  src  ) 

Duplicates a C-style string.

Parameters:
src Pointer to string to be copied
Returns:
Pointer to freshly-allocated string containing a duplicate of src or null if no memory is available

char* mystrncat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
int  n 
)

Duplicates the strncat function of C: appends the src string to the dest string, but only n characters of it the null terminator is overwritten on dest and null term. is then added. Strings cannot overlap. dest must be large enough for the operation.

Parameters:
dest pointer to string to have contents of src appended onto
src Pointer to string to be appended
n number of characters to duplicate
Returns:
Pointer to the destination string dest

char* mystrncpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
int  n 
)

Duplicates the strncpy function of C: string pointed to by src is copied into array pointed to by dest. dest must be large enough to receive the copy. Not more than n bytes are copied, so if no null terminator is in first n bytes, it is not copied. Also, if src length is less than n, remainder of dest is filled with nulls

Parameters:
dest pointer to string to have contents of src copied into
src Pointer to string to be copied
Returns:
Pointer to the destination string dest
Parameters:
n number of bytes to copy from src into dest
Note:
copies src including null term. character

char* mystrndup ( const char *  src,
int  n 
)

Duplicates a C-style string, copying at most n characters, null terminator is added

Parameters:
src Pointer to string to be copied
n number of characters to duplicate
Returns:
Pointer to freshly-allocated string containing a duplicate of src or null if no memory is available
Note:
Modified from Ciaraldi's original mystrdup function
